title: President Trump Talks About Greenland
summary: President Donald Trump talked about Greenland, a big island near the North Pole. He said Greenland is important for keeping America safe. Trump did not say exactly what he might do to get control of Greenland. He mentioned that Russia or China could try to take Greenland, and America needs to be ready. Denmark owns Greenland, and their leaders met with U.S. leaders to talk about this. They agreed to work together in a group to find a solution. Trump said he has a good relationship with Denmark and hopes something will work out. This story shows how countries discuss land and safety.

background_read: Greenland is a cold, icy island that is part of Denmark but has its own government. Countries like the United States, Russia, and China are interested in Greenland because it has resources and is in a strategic location near the Arctic. Leaders often talk about land and safety to protect their countries. This story helps us learn how presidents make decisions and work with other countries.

WHERE: The Oval Office in Washington, D.C., and a meeting in Washington
WHY: To address concerns about national security and find a way forward with Denmark
